messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] alien lifeforms WAS mushrooms like jellyfish
messages.msgSnippet: ** PS  Remember there was a Star Trek alien that looked like a box full of colored lights. The
messages.messageBody:
<<and yet on Star Trek all the aliens look like
people. <g>**


PS Remember there was a Star Trek alien that looked like a box full of
colored lights.>>



The Medusa like creature. There was one with winged bat like creatures that
were transparent. One landed on Spock, and the only way to kill it was with
light. They thought he had gone blind but he really had an extra set of
eyelids. One where they had evolved into nothing but brains; they looked
like glowing colored rocks under a glass dome. Hmmm.. I spent too much time
watching Star Trek and too little time with homework.

Janet

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] alien lifeforms WAS mushrooms like jellyfish
messages.msgSnippet: ** and yet on Star Trek all the aliens look like people. ** On Farscape, which is I think a Jim Henson production, there are many puppet aliens, which can
messages.messageBody:
**

and yet on Star Trek all the aliens look like
people. <g>**

On Farscape, which is I think a Jim Henson production, there are many puppet aliens, which can take on weirder shapes than human actors. And many of the aliens sound cooler (to me) 'cause they have Australian accents.

Now with CGI, aliens can be any shape, but it seems like they almost always look like insects. It's almost a cliche.

Betsy

PS Remember there was a Star Trek alien that looked like a box full of colored lights.
